e_topText: The use of testing contributes to the oversight provided by the Quality focus throughout the 3M | Grow phases. There are two important concepts that are linked to testing and test methods: Verification and validation.
e_left_text:
Verification is the process of testing a product to determine whether it performs in selected tests which have been selected as a proxy for the customer requirements. Verification testing shows whether a product is capable of meeting product specifications.

Divisions use a variety of tools to translate the VOC into test methods and product specifications. We will explore this in more depth when we dive deeper into the Design Qualification Matrix (DQM) tool and how it is informed by other customer voice interpretation tools, such as the House of Quality (HOQ) and the Linear House of Quality (LHOQ).
e_right_text:
Validation refers to testing at a customer in a real use situation to show that the product meets customer needs in their application. Validation testing (which can include field testing, surveys, and other methods) is always centered on the product’s intended use and is used to collect the customer’s feedback on the final design.

Validation may include customer sampling or a limited sale of product for a customer field test.
